intro: Tithymalus glabriflorus, commonly known as the smooth-flowered tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
